This 1971 Chevrolet Corvette is for sale in our Louisville KYT showroom. Road racing has long been a part of American car culture for not only showing what companies could do but just for the sheer fun. The 60"??s and 70"??s would see one of the biggest booms in the sport with Lemans and the T/A series finding plenty of fans. The sport would eventually fade away after Car manufactures began to focus on fuel economy and safety instead of performance. This example is true to that heritage and was built to look and perform as such. Probably the first thing you notice on this 71 is the headlights. Like racecars of that time the hole light assembly ahs been removed with a Lemans style piece put in its place that not only looks sportier but shaves quite a few ponds off. The front has a bottom spoiler to help with down force but you have to admit looks pretty darn good. The paint job is fitting with the company logos being nothing more than vinyl decals that can be removed if you don"??t like the look. The racing components is what really separates this road course weapon from the rest. The Bilstein shocks are race ready with the tubular control arms fiberglass leaf springs and lowered stance all add to the carving capability"??s. The Steeroids rack and pinion steering is one of the most precise setups sold for these cars eliminating any of the see saw motion in the wheel. Under the L88 hood is a 383 stroker motor from GM"??s very successful ZZ line. The huge cam and a great tune has this small block pumping out A massive 500+HP. The tremec 5 speed handles the power nicely with the built rear end having 650HP half shafts. The 3.55 gears give the perfect mix of acceleration and top end grunt. The bucket seats inside are exactly what you need if you are thinking about trying to use the car to its full potential. The 4-point cage adds rigidity to the chassis while giving a level of protection with the 4-point harness"?? keep you in place. The dash on the car has been taken out with a more race car friendly layout taking its place. The removable steering wheel allows for more room when getting in and out of the car and another item that you would expect to see in a car of this nature. The 200MPH speedometer as well as an MSD REV limiter that even has a 2 step. If you have been wanting a race car that can be driven to the track run some hot laps around the road course and then driven back home in confidence this 71 Corvette fits the bill. Options on this 1971 Corvette include Power Windows Power Brakes Cloth Interior Seat Belts T Tops and Radial Tires with Alloy Wheels. To view this car in full detail with HD pictures and video on this 1971 Chevrolet Corvette call our Louisville showroom at (812)-294-1555 or email us at

s match motor, trans and rear. Rare LS-5 454-390 hp with a 4-speed. Same woman has owned the car the last 22 years and hardly drove it. It had a body off frame restoration prior to her buying it. Exterior is slick as silk. I'm out here in the sunlight looking at it and it's simply stunning. The red paint is polished like glass. Body fits really nice, tight gaps. I didnt notice any flaws. Nice trim and glass. Bumpers are rechromed, license plate housing, taillights look new. Correct exhaust tips. I noticed the backup lights work. Of course the t-tops come off and the rear window pops out. 15x8 wheels look mint. Inside the car is very nice, not abused. It has genuine leather seats, original radio. Under the hood looks very proper and original. It is cleaned up very nicely. Has the original valve covers with the spot welds that the experts look for. Has the original ignition shielding and braided wires. Underside is very goid and proper. Solid frame, front end looks rebuilt, has spare tire carrier.
The 1970 was the peak year for horsepower, making it the most sought after. This is a very nice honest car, it really is!
$63,000 spent professionally building this stunning Vette. Done by Corvette Restoration, a shop that has specialized in high end Corvette restorations for 47 years.

MECHANICS: New crate LS-6 aluminum 5.7 liter with over 400 hp. Long tube headers connect to a custom stainless exhaust with Flowmaster mufflers. Also stainless fuel tank, new lines and fuel pump. All new brake system from master to rotors. Has painless wiring. Updated Air conditioning blows cold and the heat blows hot. Rebuilt suspension, has coil overs in front.

EXTERIOR: The wheels- wow! 20 inch Ridlers: 8.5 wide in front, 10.5 in back. Completely repainted in a stand out cobalt blue. The paint job is wet looking including the jambs. The emblems, mirrors, weather strips and window seals have been replaced. Upgraded to a 1982 style rear bumper.

INTERIOR: Another wow, the white against that blue is awesome. Has glove soft white leather seats. New white door panels bright white headliners trim. Accented with blue dash, leather steering wheel and new carpet. is white accented with the Blu Dash leather steering wheel and carpet which have all been replaced Custom electric climate controls. New stereo system too.

This is a definite head turner, eye appeal off the charts. It's like a pretty woman that can cook too. The LS-6 and 4L60E trans is the hot setup in any hot rod. This car is a head turner and a neck snapper!

For sale in our Atlanta showroom is a gorgeous 1973 Chevrolet Corvette that will turn heads at both the car shows and on the road. Powering this 73 Corvette is a 454 cubic inch V-8 engine that will have you sitting back in your seat as you take off. Putting the power to the ground with a 4-speed manual transmission that is fun shifting through each gear. With all new emblems bumpers and trim pieces this car truly shows well. Exterior is painted in a 2001 Corvette Polo Green that really pops in the sun. The custom leather interior with new carpets gives the interior just as nice of a look as the exterior making this a solid car from top to bottom. With posi-traction and all new brakes there is not much at all you would need to do to this already well taken care of Corvette for sale. So if your looking for a great looking fun driving car to be able to take to your local show or just to have for an enjoyable ride this is the car for you. Options on this 1973 Chevrolet Corvette are: A/C am/fm radio cd player spare tire hub caps power steering posi-traction seat belts leather interior rally wheels and raised white letter radial tires. 1973 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible
One of 4,943 ‘Vette Convertibles made in 1973
First year for five-mph front bumper
350 CID V-8 engine (code L48) with four-barrel carb
Turbo Hydramatic 400 three-speed automatic transmission
Elkhart Green Metallic exterior (code 947) with new, tan top and Medium Saddle Vinyl interior (code 415)
Air-conditioning, power steering and power four-wheel disc brakes
New carpet
Rallye wheels with white-letter tires and rear luggage rack
Sold on an actual mileage title, showing 88,xxx miles
MotoeXotica Classic Cars is pleased to present this 1973 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible. As an entry point into classic car collecting, this would be an ideal candidate.

Like almost all Corvettes made between 1954 and 1981, this car came off the line right here at GM's St. Louis, Missouri factory. Dressed in desirable Elkhart Green Metallic (code 947), the car's paint and trim are in overall average condition however, there are blemishes visible on the car's nose, passenger side fender, the hard tonneau behind the seats, at the right rear taillight and at the windshield frame. This Corvette is very presentable but not perfect.

The car's glass panels are in overall good shape and the passenger side window still bears the original Astro Ventilation logo. The car's lights are in satisfactory shape while overall, the car's body work is in great order. The engine bay is tidy, the cargo area behind the seats is satisfactory, there's an external, chrome luggage rack for additional storage and the car's bumpers fit well to the body. The undercarriage looks to be very solid.

The car rolls on Firestone Firehawk white letter radials, size 255/60R15 at all four corners and each tire is wrapped around a slotted Rallye wheel. The tires show their age but the wheels are in good order.

Under the forward-hinged hood is a 350 CID V-8 engine (code L48) with a Rochester Quadra-Jet 4MV four-barrel carburetor. Mated to the engine is a Turbo Hydramatic 400 three-speed automatic transmission. Driver convenience features include air-conditioning, power steering and power four-wheel disc brakes.

Inside, the car's Medium Saddle vinyl interior (code 415) has new matching carpeting while the bucket seats are in very good order. A light switch knob is missing, the three-spoke, wrapped steering wheel, inner door panels, instrument panel and center stack with full instrumentation all look good, however the tachometer is inoperable. The center console and shifter are in similar, satisfactory condition. Completing the interior is a factory AM/FM stereo.
Nineteen seventy-three started the Corvette's transformation from muscle to touring sports car. A Chevrolet advertisement headlined: “We gave it radials, a quieter ride, guard beams and a nose job.”

Indeed, redesigned body mounts and radial tires did improve Corvette's ride, and interior sound levels were reduced by 40 percent. The chrome rear bumper carried over from the previous year. However, the chrome blade front bumper was dropped for the federally required five mph standard for a light-weight front bumper system with an inner transverse tube attached to the frame with two Omark-bolts (special steel fasteners which absorbed energy when a forming die, pushed back by the bumper, was forced down their length) and an injection-molded urethane bumper cover. Engineers chose the urethane nose was chosen over the alternative, a more protruding version of the previous metal bumper. The new urethane bumper assembly added 35 pounds to the front end. Other changes included a domed hood and a fixed rear window, which provided additional interior storage space.
Competition to this Chevrolet in 1973 included Datsun's 240Z, Excalibur's Series II Roadster, Jaguar's E-Type V12 Convertible, Mercedes-Benz's 450 SL and Porsche's 911.
If you're a novice collector looking for your first classic sports car or if you're a Vetteophile looking for a new ride, come by MotoeXotica Classic Cars today to check this one out.
This car is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer shows 88,109 miles. It is sold as is, where is, on a clean and clear, actual mileage title.

1978 Chevrolet Corvette
Low, 39,000 Actual Miles
Eckler turbo-designed body package
Red exterior with yellow, orange and red striping and a red interior
Naturally-aspirated L82 350 CID V-8 engine breathing through dual side-exit exhausts
Turbo Hydramatic 350 three-speed automatic transmission and 3.55 gearing
IMSA-style body flares with NACA ducts in front and louvered bubble in rear
Silver, reflective glass T-tops
Royce Ltd. Seats covered in red leather
Tru-Spoke wire wheels
Recessed headlights with clear plexiglass covers
Featured in 1983 issue of Custom Rodder

While it is not right-hand drive and you probably won't meet Mark Hamill or Annie Potts while driving it, MotoeXotica Classic Cars is pleased to offer the closest thing to the car seen in “Corvette Summer,” this 1978 Chevrolet Corvette. The Vette was every school boys dream in the day being the ultimate “Macho Man” car, complete with the L82 power plant!

This particular example, like all '54 through '81 Vettes, was made in GM's St. Louis, Missouri assembly plant. It has since been enhanced with an Eckler turbo-designed body package with International Motor Sport Association (IMSA) body flares and NACA ducts in front and a louvered backlight. The paint and trim are in overall excellent condition, as are the glass panels, including the rear window with electric defroster. There are some spider cracks in the paint upon very close inspection but overall very hard to detect. The car's lights are very good order with the factory, round pop-up headlights replaced by recessed quad rectangular units covered by transparent plexiglass.

This ‘Vette rolls on BFGoodrich Radial T/A tires, size P255/60R15 in front and P275/60R15 in back and each radial surrounds a Tru-Spoke wire wheel with center spinners. The tires and wheels are in very good condition.

The car's bodywork is straight and solid; including the silver reflective glass T-tops. Ralph Eckler began as a one-man body shop in Rock Island, Illinois in 1961. Eleven years later, he published his first catalog, offering fiberglass and other Corvette body parts. The engine bay is very tidy, the battery appears new, the cargo area behind the bucket seats is in good order and the car's bumpers fit well to the rest of the body.

Under the hood is a naturally aspirated 350 CID V-8 with electronic ignition that breathes through dual side-exit exhausts and is hooked to a Turbo Hydramatic 350 three-speed automatic transmission and back by a 3.55:1 rear end. Driver convenience features include air-conditioning, cruise control, power steering, power four-wheel disc brakes, and power windows.

Inside, the car's red interior is eye-popping. Pair of red Royce Limited red bucket seats replaced the factory seats and are in overall very good order. The matching red carpeting is in very good shape, too, while the red instrument panel, with its full instrumentation, three-spoke steering wheel, red inner door panels, mirror glass, center console and shift lever with wood handle are all in good order. Completing the interior is a factory AM/FM stereo with cassette deck.
This vehicle was featured in a 1983 issue of Custom Rodder magazine.

Nineteen seventy-eight was the Corvette's 25th Anniversary and all 78s featured silver anniversary nose and fuel door emblems. A new fastback rear window was the most dramatic and noticeable styling change, giving the 10-year-old C3 Corvette body style a fresh lease on life. The fixed-glass fastback benefited both aerodynamics and increased the usable luggage space behind the seats while improving rearward visibility in the bargain. The tachometer and speedometer were redesigned to match the new “aircraft styled” center console and gauge cluster first seen the previous year. Redesigned interior door panels were also new as well as an actual glove box was added in front of the passenger seat, replacing the map pockets of previous years.

Available options now included power door locks, a power antenna, dual rear speakers and a CB radio. The optional convenience group, introduced the previous year, now included intermittent (delay) wipers, floor mats, and the passenger side vanity mirror was an upgraded illuminated unit.  The more desirable L82 engines were also now fitted with an aluminum intake manifold, which saved 24 pounds compared to the cast iron unit of previous years. The Corvette converted to metric tires with the P225/70R15 as standard. Wider P255/60R15 tires were available as an option and required fender trimming from the factory for clearance. The fuel tank capacity increased from 17 to 24 gallons on all cars. To make room for the larger tank, a smaller (P195/80D15) space saver spare tire was utilized.
Competition to this Corvette in 1978 included the Avanti II, Datsun's 280Z, Jaguar's XJ-S, Mazda's RX-7, Mercedes-Benz's 450SL and Porsche's 911.

This car is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer shows 39,215 miles. It is sold as is, where is, on a clean and clear, actual mileage title. GET OUT AND DRIVE!!!

title: 1973 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe With Removable Tops

description: Classic Corvettes are always a good investment, whether you're a collector or an enthusiast. Every year Corvettes continue to gain value and the 3rd generation is on the rise. This example is a very nice coupe powered by a professionally rebuilt, matching numbers, 350C.I. V8 engine with some mild upgrades including a stainless steel Flowmaster exhaust, mated to a Turbo-Hydramatic transmission. Other optional extras include power steering, factory air-conditioning (upgraded to R134A), Rally wheels, luggage rack, and tilt steering wheel. This coupe has had a frame-off restoration and is finished in Mille Miglia Red with a very nice Medium Saddle Interior. It also comes with removable roof panels for a fun open-top experience. 1973 is also the only year the Corvette was ever made with a chrome bumper at the rear only, making it a rarity. It's likey that 3rd generation Corvettes will continue to go up in value. It's best to get one while you still can!
